alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 9:44AM CST until January 29 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Sumter, Greene and Pickens Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening.late tonight at 1245 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From this morning to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 121.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 124.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
